description: A simple yet delicious bread that is a staple in Irish households, perfect for any occasion.
instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). 2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, baking soda, and salt. If using raisins or currants, add them now. 3. Make a well in the center and pour in the buttermilk. Mix until a soft dough forms. 4. Shape into a round loaf on a floured surface. 5. Score the top with a deep cross. 6. Bake for 35-45 minutes until golden brown. 7. Cool on a wire rack for at least 15 minutes before serving.
notes: You can substitute up to 50% of the all-purpose flour with whole wheat flour for a healthier option. If you don't have buttermilk, mix 1 tablespoon of vinegar or lemon juice with a cup of milk.
